dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, big news this week, uh, Sweden has officially halted its investigation into those long-standing rape allegations against WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, big news this week, uh, Sweden has officially halted its investigation into those long-standing rape allegations against WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sweden is reopening an investigation into allegations of rape against Wikileaks founder Julian Assange.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, wow, really? I thought that whole saga was, like, never going to end. Didn't they reopen it a few years ago?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, wow, really? I thought that whole saga was, like, never going to end. Didn't they reopen it a few years ago?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They did! They reopened it in 2017. But, get this, Assange himself, uh, requested in early April that the Swedish Prosecution Authority not look into the case again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They did! They reopened it in twenty seventeen. But, get this, Assange himself, uh, requested in early April that the Swedish Prosecution Authority not look into the case again.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The announcement landed Monday, after the lawyer for the alleged victim requested in early April the Swedish Prosecution Authority look into the case again.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. Interesting timing. Especially after he just got sentenced to 50 weeks for breaking his bail conditions, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. Interesting timing. Especially after he just got sentenced to fifty weeks for breaking his bail conditions, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Assange was sentenced to 50 weeks for breaking his bail conditions at the start of May.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And, um, he'd spent seven years in the Ecuadorian embassy, trying to avoid being extradited to Sweden in the first place.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And, um, he'd spent seven years in the Ecuadorian embassy, trying to avoid being extradited to Sweden in the first place.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Having spent seven years in the Ecuadorian embassy in London, where he'd taken asylum to avoid extradition to Sweden, Assange was sentenced to 50 weeks for breaking his bail conditions at the start of May.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, right. So, what changed for Sweden to just… drop it now? I mean, he admits the allegations, doesn't he?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, right. So, what changed for Sweden to just... drop it now? I mean, he admits the allegations, doesn't he?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Assange, who denies the rape allegations first made in 2010, has faced numerous legal actions over the last month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he admits the allegations first made in 2010. But the director of public prosecution, Eva-Marie Persson, said they won't even ask for an interview in the UK. She said it would require him to, uh, refuse to cooperate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he admits the allegations first made in twenty ten. But the director of public prosecution, Eva-Marie Persson, said they won't even ask for an interview in the U K. She said it would require him to, uh, refuse to cooperate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Persson said investigators will ask for an interview with Assange in the U.K., but noted it would require the Wikileaks founder to cooperate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] So, like, no European arrest warrant then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, no European arrest warrant then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope, none. The Swedish prosecutor won't issue one. But this doesn't mean he's a free man, obviously.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope, none. The Swedish prosecutor won't issue one. But this doesn't mean he's a free man, obviously.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Swedish prosecutor will issue a European arrest warrant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, God, no. The US extradition hearings are still very much happening, aren't they? That's the real big one now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, God, no. The U S extradition hearings are still very much happening, aren't they? That's the real big one now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hearings into his possible extradition to America have begun, but will likely take months to conclude.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Those hearings have started and are expected to conclude this week. And the UK authorities are going to be the ones deciding on the priority if there's a conflict between, like, an EU release and a US extradition request.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Those hearings have started and are expected to conclude this week. And the U K authorities are going to be the ones deciding on the priority if there's a conflict between, like, an E U release and a U S extradition request.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hearings into his possible extradition to America have begun, but will likely take months to conclude.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Gosh, it’s just one thing after another for him. He was pardoned by the US government over that whole Chelsea Manning thing, but still faces potential imprisonment in America. It’s so confusing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Gosh, it's just one thing after another for him. He was pardoned by the U S government over that whole Chelsea Manning thing, but still faces potential imprisonment in America. It's so confusing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He was also indicted by the U.S. government over an alleged conspiracy with Chelsea Manning to crack the password of a military computer in order to steal sensitive files.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it’s a total legal minefield. Persson, the prosecutor, actually said the outcome of this whole process is 'completely predictable.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a total legal minefield. Persson, the prosecutor, actually said the outcome of this whole process is completely predictable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The outcome of this process is impossible to predict, said deputy director of public prosecution Eva-Marie Persson.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Predictable in what sense, though, uh, for *him*?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Predictable in what sense, though, uh, for him?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, I think she means predictable in that the Swedish case closing doesn't automatically clear his path to freedom. It seems, uh, the US is still very much in play.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, I think she means predictable in that the Swedish case closing doesn't automatically clear his path to freedom. It seems, uh, the U S is still very much in play.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, despite this Swedish development, it really just clears the deck for the next, much bigger, legal fight. Still no easy answers for Julian Assange, then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, despite this Swedish development, it really just clears the deck for the next, much bigger, legal fight. Still no easy answers for Julian Assange, then.
